TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi NetworkAvailableEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for the and events.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.WindowsFormsApplicationBase.NetworkAvailabilityChanged?displayProperty=nameWithType> and the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Devices.Network.NetworkAvailabilityChanged?displayProperty=nameWithType> events occur when the availability of the network changes.
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Devices.NetworkAvailableEventArgs> contains the new state of the network connection. To get the current state of the network connection, use the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Devices.Network.IsAvailable%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(bool networkAvailable) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: A that indicates whether a network is available to the application.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.WindowsFormsApplicationBase.NetworkAvailabilityChanged?displayProperty=nameWithType> and the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Devices.Network.NetworkAvailabilityChanged?displayProperty=nameWithType> events occur when the availability of the network changes.
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Devices.NetworkAvailableEventArgs> contains the new state of the network connection. To get the current state of the network connection, use the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Devices.Network.IsAvailable%2A> property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.WindowsFormsApplicationBase.NetworkAvailabilityChanged?displayProperty=nameWithType> and the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Devices.Network.NetworkAvailabilityChanged?displayProperty=nameWithType> events occur when the availability of the network changes.
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Devices.NetworkAvailableEventArgs> contains the new state of the network connection. To get the current state of the network connection, use the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Devices.Network.IsAvailable%2A> property.
